trans-unit.source: Deploy the ARM template by using click to deploy
trans-unit.target: Deploy the ARM template by using click to deploy

trans-unit.source: You can reuse pre-defined ARM templates upload to a github repository maintained by Microsoft and open to the community.
trans-unit.target: You can reuse pre-defined ARM templates upload to a github repository maintained by Microsoft and open to the community.

trans-unit.source: THese templates can be deployed straight out of github, or downloaded and modified to fit your needs.
trans-unit.target: THese templates can be deployed straight out of github, or downloaded and modified to fit your needs.

trans-unit.source: To deploy a template that creates a VNet with two subnets, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To deploy a template that creates a VNet with two subnets, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: From a browser, navigate to <link><linkText>https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: From a browser, navigate to <link><linkText>https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down the list of templates, and click 101-two-subnets.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down the list of templates, and click 101-two-subnets.

trans-unit.source: Check the README.md file, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Check the README.md file, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>READEME.md file in github</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>READEME.md file in github</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy to Azure.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, enter your Azure login credentials.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, enter your Azure login credentials.

trans-unit.source: In the Parameters blade, enter the values you want to use to create your new VNet, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Parameters blade, enter the values you want to use to create your new VNet, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: The figure below shows the values for our scenario.
trans-unit.target: The figure below shows the values for our scenario.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ARM template parameters</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ARM template parameters</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Resource group and select a resource group to add the VNet to, or click Create new to add the VNet to a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Click Resource group and select a resource group to add the VNet to, or click Create new to add the VNet to a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about resource groups, see <link><linkText></linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about resource groups, see <link><linkText></linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The figure below shows the resource group settings for a new resource group called TestRG.
trans-unit.target: The figure below shows the resource group settings for a new resource group called TestRG.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Resource group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Resource group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If necessary, change the Subscription and Location settings for your VNet.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, change the Subscription and Location settings for your VNet.

trans-unit.source: If you do not want to see the VNet as a tile in the Startboard, disable Pin to Startboard.
trans-unit.target: If you do not want to see the VNet as a tile in the Startboard, disable Pin to Startboard.

trans-unit.source: Click Leagl terms, read the terms, and click Buy to agree.
trans-unit.target: Click Leagl terms, read the terms, and click Buy to agree.

trans-unit.source: Click Create to create the VNet.
trans-unit.target: Click Create to create the VNet.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Submitting deployment tile in preview portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Submitting deployment tile in preview portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the deployment is done, click TestVNet > All settings > Subnets to see the subnet properties, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Once the deployment is done, click TestVNet > All settings > Subnets to see the subnet properties, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create VNet in preview portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create VNet in preview portal</linkText>
